protocol_name: Primary culture of nodose ganglion neurons from mouse
protocol_name_html: Primary culture of nodose ganglion neurons from mouse
description: The present protocol explains how to prepare a primary culture of isolated neurons from the mouse nodose ganglion.
warning: Maintain and handle animals in accordance with the experimental procedures approved by the regional Research Council and Scientific Committee responsible in your area and institution.
manuscript_citation: Cadaveira-Mosquera A, Perez M, Reboreda A, Rivas-Ramirez P, Fernandez-Fernandez D, Lamas JA. Expression of K2P channels in sensory and motor neurons of the autonomic nervous system. J Mol Neurosci. 2012;48(1):86-96. doi: 10.1007/s12031-012-9780-y. PMID: 22544515;
authors: Diego Fernández-Fernández,Alba Cadaveira,Antonio Reboreda,Paula Rivas-Ramírez,J. Antonio Lamas
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Anaesthesia and ganglia extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Deeply anaesthesise the mouse using a CO2 chamber or isoflurane overdose.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Deeply anaesthesise the mouse using a CO2 chamber or isoflurane overdose.

source_data.annotation:
Mice are SWISS CD1 strain

30-60 days old

Male and females.

12-h light : 12-h dark cycle

Fed ab libitum

components.data: Anaesthesia and ganglia extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Check that the animal is anaesthesised assesing foot pad pinch. If the animal responds to this stimulation, apply further anaesthetic.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check that the animal is anaesthesised assesing foot pad pinch. If the animal responds to this stimulation, apply further anaesthetic.

components.data: Anaesthesia and ganglia extraction
components.name: Section

components.data:
While anaesthesised, quickly sacrifice the animal by decapitation.

Position the backwards and pin. Cut medial from the base of the neck to the mouth. Pin the traquea to see the nodose ganglion as an enlargement of the vagus nerve, which goes parallel to the carotid artery (see figure).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
While anaesthesised, quickly sacrifice the animal by decapitation.

Position the backwards and pin. Cut medial from the base of the neck to the mouth. Pin the traquea to see the nodose ganglion as an enlargement of the vagus nerve, which goes parallel to the carotid artery (see figure).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 3 of Primary culture of nodose ganglion neurons from mouse
source_data.protocol_name: Primary culture of nodose ganglion neurons from mouse
source_data.protocol_name_html: Primary culture of nodose ganglion neurons from mouse
source_data.annotation: Use autoclaved surgery material during all extraction procedures. Material should be kept in 70º alcohol while it is not being used during the procedure. Before use, it has to be wash in destilate water and saline (NaCl 0.9 %) for removal of ganglia.
source_data.thread_text: Use autoclaved surgery material during all extraction procedures. Material should be kept in 70º alcohol while it is not being used during the procedure. Before use, it has to be wash in destilate water and saline (NaCl 0.9 %) for removal of ganglia.
source_data.body: Use autoclaved surgery material during all extraction procedures. Material should be kept in 70º alcohol while it is not being used during the procedure. Before use, it has to be wash in destilate water and saline (NaCl 0.9 %) for removal of ganglia.

components.data: Anaesthesia and ganglia extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Quickly isolate the ganglion by cutting it free from the vagus nerve. Do the same procedure with the second, billateral ganglion.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Quickly isolate the ganglion by cutting it free from the vagus nerve. Do the same procedure with the second, billateral ganglion.

components.data: Anaesthesia and ganglia extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Transfer both ganglia to a 35 mm well filled with 1 mL of cold medium (L-15).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer both ganglia to a 35 mm well filled with 1 mL of cold medium (L-15).

components.data: Anaesthesia and ganglia extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Under magnification, clean both ganglia from rests of other tissue, specially blood.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Under magnification, clean both ganglia from rests of other tissue, specially blood.

components.data: Enzymatic treatment
components.name: Section

components.data:
The following material must be sterilized and kept in a laminar flow cabinet:

  • Corning wells 35 mm.
  • Tubes 10 mL.
  • Two pasteur glass pipettes (one with a thin polished mouth and another with a broader mouth).
  • L-15 medium without L-glutamine.
  • Hanks’ Balanced Salt Solution (HBSS) + HEPES. HEPES 1 M is added to HBSS to get a final concentration of 10 mM HEPES.
  • Culture medium: 50 mL L-15 supplemented with supplemented with 10% foetal calf serum, 24 mM NaHCO3, 38 mM D-glucose, 100 UI/ml penicillin-100 μg/ml streptomicyn, 2 mM L-glutamine and 50 ng/ml nerve growth factor. Keep at 4º C before use.
  • Trypsin: 1 mg/ml in HBSS + 6 mg/mL albumin.
  • Colagenase: 2.5 mg/ml in HBSS + 6 mg/ml albúmin.
  • Laminin: prepare 3 wells with 200 µL of laminin each (10 mg/ml solved in Earle’s Balanced Salts Solution (EBSS)). Before harvesting, drop of laminin must be incubated for at least two hours in the incubator (37 ºC, 95% O2/5% CO2).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
The following material must be sterilized and kept in a laminar flow cabinet:

  • Corning wells 35 mm.
  • Tubes 10 mL.
  • Two pasteur glass pipettes (one with a thin polished mouth and another with a broader mouth).
  • L-15 medium without L-glutamine.
  • Hanks’ Balanced Salt Solution (HBSS) + HEPES. HEPES 1 M is added to HBSS to get a final concentration of 10 mM HEPES.
  • Culture medium: 50 mL L-15 supplemented with supplemented with 10% foetal calf serum, 24 mM NaHCO3, 38 mM D-glucose, 100 UI/ml penicillin-100 μg/ml streptomicyn, 2 mM L-glutamine and 50 ng/ml nerve growth factor. Keep at 4º C before use.
  • Trypsin: 1 mg/ml in HBSS + 6 mg/mL albumin.
  • Colagenase: 2.5 mg/ml in HBSS + 6 mg/ml albúmin.
  • Laminin: prepare 3 wells with 200 µL of laminin each (10 mg/ml solved in Earle’s Balanced Salts Solution (EBSS)). Before harvesting, drop of laminin must be incubated for at least two hours in the incubator (37 ºC, 95% O2/5% CO2).

components.data: Enzymatic treatment
components.name: Section

components.data: After cleaning for extra tissue, In the laminar flow cabinet ganglia must be washed 3 times with 2 ml of HBSS + HEPES.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After cleaning for extra tissue, In the laminar flow cabinet ganglia must be washed 3 times with 2 ml of HBSS + HEPES.

components.data: Enzymatic treatment
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 2 mL of colagenase solution and incubate during 15 minutes (37 ºC, 95% O2/5% CO2).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 2 mL of colagenase solution and incubate during 15 minutes (37 ºC, 95% O2/5% CO2).

components.data: Enzymatic treatment
components.name: Section

components.data:
Wash again two times with HBSS + HEPES to remove colagenase.

 

Add 2 mL of trypsin solution and incubate during 30 minutes (37 ºC, 95% O2/5% CO2).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Wash again two times with HBSS + HEPES to remove colagenase.

 

Add 2 mL of trypsin solution and incubate during 30 minutes (37 ºC, 95% O2/5% CO2).

components.data: Tissue disaggregation and seeding
components.name: Section

components.data:
Take both ganglia with the smallest possible amount of trypsin and place them in a 10 mL tube containing 2 mL medium (FCS in the medium will stop trypsinization).

 

Using the small tip pasteur pipette, gently dissociate the ganglia until they are no longer visible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Take both ganglia with the smallest possible amount of trypsin and place them in a 10 mL tube containing 2 mL medium (FCS in the medium will stop trypsinization).

 

Using the small tip pasteur pipette, gently dissociate the ganglia until they are no longer visible.

components.data: Tissue disaggregation and seeding
components.name: Section

components.data:
Transfer the 3 mL cell suspension to another 10 mL tube containing 3 mL L-15.

 

Centrifugate this tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Transfer the 3 mL cell suspension to another 10 mL tube containing 3 mL L-15.

 

Centrifugate this tube.

components.data: Tissue disaggregation and seeding
components.name: Section

components.data:
After centrifugation, carefully poor the supernatant out of the tube.

 

Add culture medium to the remaining pellet of neurons (visible as a white spot at the bottom of the tube).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
After centrifugation, carefully poor the supernatant out of the tube.

 

Add culture medium to the remaining pellet of neurons (visible as a white spot at the bottom of the tube).

source_data.title: cultured medium to the tube with the pellet

components.data: Tissue disaggregation and seeding
components.name: Section

components.data: During centrifugation, take the laminin coated wells and remove the laminin. Wash the place were the laminin drop was at least 2 times with L-15. Then remove the L-15 and leave the well empty.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: During centrifugation, take the laminin coated wells and remove the laminin. Wash the place were the laminin drop was at least 2 times with L-15. Then remove the L-15 and leave the well empty.

components.data: Tissue disaggregation and seeding
components.name: Section

components.data: Seed 200 mL of medium + cells in suspension in the centre of each of the three wells (where the laminin drop was previously adhered).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seed 200 mL of medium + cells in suspension in the centre of each of the three wells (where the laminin drop was previously adhered).

components.data: Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the wells with cells in the incubator.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the wells with cells in the incubator.

components.data: Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Carefully, add 2 mL of culture medium to each well. Make sure that the medium is not cold.

 

Keep cells in the incubator during at least 24 hours before the electrophysiological experiments.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Carefully, add 2 mL of culture medium to each well. Make sure that the medium is not cold.

 

Keep cells in the incubator during at least 24 hours before the electrophysiological experiments.
